meanings.definition: Propjets (noun): A type of aircraft engine that uses a propeller for propulsion.
meanings.sent1: The propjets on the plane spun rapidly, pushing it through the sky.
meanings.sent2: The propjets of the aircraft were loud but efficient in moving it forward.
meanings.sent3: The propjets on the old plane hummed like a swarm of bees.
meanings.sent4: The propjets roared to life, propelling the aircraft into the clouds.
meanings.sent5: I could feel the power of the propjets as the plane took off.

meanings.definition: Propjets (verb): To propel or move forward using a propeller.
meanings.sent1: The wind propjets the sailboat across the lake.
meanings.sent2: The engine propjets the small plane smoothly through the air.
meanings.sent3: I propjets my bike up the hill with determination.
meanings.sent4: The water propjets the canoe downstream effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The propjets of the boat create a soothing sound as it moves forward.

meanings.definition: Propjets (adjective): Describing something related to or characteristic of propeller-driven aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The propjets aircraft soared gracefully in the clear sky.
meanings.sent2: The propjets design of the plane made it efficient for long flights.
meanings.sent3: The propjets model of the aircraft was a favorite among aviation enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The propjets technology allowed the plane to fly quietly.
meanings.sent5: The propjets features of the aircraft were evident in its streamlined design.
